Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, next to Metro stop”
Reviews.Author: ScottEmmaLee
Reviews.Content: Booked two rooms for family via Gate 1 Travel (mid priced selection). We arrived at train station and walked 2-3 blocks to hotel. Large rooms (desk, and 2 chairs), full breakfast buffet, front door is practically at steps to Sants Estacio Metro stop. We found rooms to be clean and comfortable. Front desk staff was helpful with restuarnt suggestions (Casa Martelo) and confirming AeroCity airport transfer. I would stay here again when on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but some issues with food”
Reviews.Author: pelicanoPortugal
Reviews.Content: Me, my wife and my daughter spent 4 nights at this hotel in Easter time. The staff was nice, maybe some of the waiters at the restaurant can speak a little more English, but that was the exception, not the rule. They were very friendly. The rooms are average with good beds and medium bathrooms. They are clean and the amenities are enough. The location are very good, just some footsteps from the metro station, and this is the green line, which is the best one for seeing Barcelona attractions. That was very convenient. The biggest problem, and the reason we only rated with 3 and not 4 stars, was the restaurant and the lack of choice in the menu and some lack of quality of the food. The lack of choice was greater when they have a weekend menu (that they applied also on holidays) that only have sandwich and some bad spaghetti and only one option of desert. We had bought half board before we go and were so sorry that in the last day we went to Mac and prefer to loose the money. Besides that i think this can be a fair option to stay in Barcelona, specially if we want to go to the Barcelona Fair or to Barcelona football stadium.

Reviews.Title: “good for 1 night stay, room looks old, and smells like tobacco”
Reviews.Author: pfm81
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel out of necessity for 1 night. The hotel is two blocks away from the Sants train station. The hotel lobby looks pretty good and clean, but this was a big contrast from my room. The room i got looked old, and worn out. I preferred to walk with slippers around the room. Also, the room had a very strong tobacco smell. I suppose this used to be a smoking room. The a/c was not working properly, so i had to sleep with the window open, thankfully it was cool outside. The bathroom was clean, but the shower had a soap and shampoo dispenser a, which made it look cheap and unhygienic. I would only recommend this hotel if you just need a quick overnight hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for exploring in and around Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: orator11
Reviews.Content: Located about five minutes' walk from the Sants train station, this is a convenient base to explore Barcelona. During our five days there, we went on several day trips, including to the towns of Sitges (lovely beach town), Girona and Figueres, where Dali lived. There are also easy links to the airport and within the town itself. The rooms are moderately sized but clean, and there is wi-fi though you have to pay for it. There is a free PC in the lobby but it is usually taken up for long periods. Round the corner are a couple of supermarkets and there are two good family run restaurants across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel for business”
Reviews.Author: Peggy_Pegster
Reviews.Content: Because I was here for a business trip - location is all it matters, this hotel is 3 mins away from Sants Station which is very convenient. The lobby of the hotel is really modern, but not when I stepped into the lifts and then the room afterwards. I was on Level 6. Rooms are Decent really - good size - but it look pretty tired like in the 80s. The bathroom has a bath tub with a shower head - they have soap and shampoo from a dispenser. Good size bathroom except I think they have problems with their drainage system I thought I can smell the pipes everytime I walked in. There is a temperature control on the wall but I think it doesn't work at all. The room was really warm in March, I have to open the windows.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a visit”
Reviews.Author: Gulliver077
Reviews.Content: I stayed in The Abba Sants hotel in March 2012 on a four day business trip. I was very pleasantly surprsied by a number of factors - the hotel itself is well located and close to a Metro station. My bedroom was modern, clean and spacious - as was the bathroom. I did have a room that was on the third floor and looked out onto the street which was very noisy with traffic when the window was opened. WiFi access is available in the bedrooms (at an additional cost) and it's quite fast. FreeWiFi access is available in the hotel lobby is but I found it to be slow and unreliable. As regrds food, I only had breakfast in the hotel which I thought was moderate (a big plus is that the coffee is Nespresso and it's all you can drink !!). On the negative side, there are no health facilities in the hotel which I found to be disappointing. Also, teh bar service in the hotel was poor and very unhelpful and unfriendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: HoBisognoDiVacanza
Reviews.Content: I have bene here 4 times always for Mobile World Congress. During such event prices are crazy but rooms are comfortable and people nice. Anyway I think it has a reasonable price/quality ratio.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, convenient for metro and train station. Friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Vita25
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just a few steps away from the subway which will bring you to the shopping area, La Ramblas and other sights easily. You are a 5mins walk from Barcelona Sants where you can board the high speed trans to Airport or to Paris. The rooms are very comfortable and large.

Reviews.Title: “Visit 21 Jan 2012”
Reviews.Author: greatorexpectations
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located as previous reviews have explained - next to the metro station and on the green line 3 which takes you straight to all the major attractions. The only issue for me was that the air conditioning is set to heat only during the Spanish winter. With daytime temperatures of 16 degrees plus the room was very warm and I found it difficult to sleep. There was a lot of traffic noise as well but I was well prepared for this with ear plugs. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. My partner found the issue of no free wi-fi in the rooms a negative but I was pleased by this as it meant he didn't spend all of our holiday on his iphone. The bed was large and comfortable (if you like a hard bed) and the room was clean. Overall apart from the lack of air conditioning very good.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for short trip”
Reviews.Author: SaraAF
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night during a weekend trip to Barcelona. It is so easy ot reach from the airport, Metro and 5 minute walk. Very friendly reception, great room. BUT we were on the 5th floor, street side,was very loud during the night and WARM...in January! Minibar was expensive but agian, there are so many bars and fun places to have a drink - who needs a minibar? ;.)

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay!”
Reviews.Author: Anastasia G
Reviews.Content: Very clean and large rooms, with all comforts available! The staff is very friendly and they clean the rooms everyday! Nice location next to the Abba Sants Metro Station! Unfortunatelly the breakfast buffet wasn't what I was expecting! Limited choice of food!

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel, but away from the action”
Reviews.Author: TravelerViajante
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good overall. The rooms are nice and clean and the staff at front desk speak English. Manuel at the front desk was very helpfully in giving us the correct directions the metro stations, museums and attractions. The buffet breakfast is a bit overpriced considering you can get a good selection of breads and coffe across the street for a fraction of the price they charge at hotel. I would give it a 5 stars but the location is a bit far away from the gothic quarter and las ramblas. However, there is a metro station right in front of the hotel that will take you anywhere in the city, since Barcelona is very easy and convenient to navigate by metro. Also, the first hour of wifi in the common areas of the hotel is free, but not in the rooms. We paid almost $40 in order to have Internet in our room for 3 days that we only used at night. This was a big let down for us considering that we have been traveling through out Spain and every hotel or hotels we stayed offered free wifi. Overall, this is a good hotel and i would recommend if you don't mind taking the metro everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Used to be great, I'm sure but...”
Reviews.Author: gsfg5007
Reviews.Content: You could tell that this used to be an impressive property. And Abba hotels are generally very nice and modern. This one is in desperate need of refurbishment. Cracks in the ceiling, bathroom a bit moldy, A/C vents that were hanging down, etc.. (And this was an upgraded room on the top floor with a private balcony, which in all fairness was a spectacular view) Speaking of the A/C in the upgraded rooms. If you open the sliding door, the A/C automatically turns off. We did not know this and in August were quite quickly burning up. Apparently, there is a hidden censor near the door that turns it back on when the door is closed. If you dont trip that censor, good luck. Great location. Walked all over Barcelona from the hotel. Lobby and breakfast area are small. Elevators are extremely small and wont operate with more than 4 people (literally wont move). Abba, this one needs help to bring it back to a former glory. Overall, Barcelona is gorgeous and I will go back but wont stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “High Quality Close to Metro”
Reviews.Author: CTBurke
Reviews.Content: Two nights wasn't enough for us, but we were going on a Mediterranean cruise out of Barcelona and stayed at Abba Sants on a recommendation. WOW! The staff was highly accommodating, the room was spacious (we had a balcony in the "Penthouse") and quiet, the bed soft and comfortable, and we had a Metro station a minute away. Breakfast was very good, too.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KruiseT
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Abba Sants in Barcelona for two nights prior to a cruise. We were able to take the train from the airport and only had to walk a couple of blocks to check into the hotel. Check in was easy and we were very pleased to find that we had a big room on the penthouse level with a balcony overlooking the city. We hadn't paid any extra for it, so we were quite surprised! The metro is literally steps from the front door, so we bought a pass that would allow us to use the buses and metro all day. We took the metro to Las Ramblas, then a bus up to Gaudi's Park Guell. We took another metro in the evening to the waterfront area and really enjoyed walking around that area too. Transportation was a breeze! Our balcony had a nice table and chairs so we took advantage of that. The bathroom was also very large and well stocked with various supplies. Breakfast was included and they had an excellent variety of choices. There are many stores and restaurants within walking distance. All in all, this was a great choice and we would DEFINITELY choose to stay at the Abba Sants again if we ever return to Barcelona! Don't miss La Boqueria ( a big open market) on Las Ramblas...amazing!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay at Abba Sants”
Reviews.Author: trescomania
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel on Late Rooms as it showed an excellent rate for June, We were picking up our cruise ship in Barcelona and wanted to see this gorgeous city for a few days before. It was clean, very comfy with lovely staff. The main advantage tho is the situation - next to the main trainline of the city, and a metrostop that takes you anywhere in the city speedily and cheaply. In walking distance is Montjuic with the fabulous dancing fountains, cable cars and Olympic sites, as well as the Spanish village. the hotel is in a quiet area, but with easy access to all the wonderful attractions.

Reviews.Title: “good location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jay M
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the abba sants hotel with my girlfriend as a pre christmas treat. Have to say the hotel staff were very helpful, the rooms were clean and the beds were huge. Easy access to the city buy the train/tube central station that is literally 2 mins walk. Also via diagonal is within easy walking distance too. Didnt eat in the restaurant or drink there as im a frequent visitor to Barcelona (have my favourite places to go eat/drink there) but prices seemed fairly reasonable for a hotel. Would definately consider staying here again on a future visit to barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for high quality”
Reviews.Author: Paco_Irene
Reviews.Content: The situation of the hotel is perfect, 5 min. to Sants Railway Station and in front of subway station. Sants is close to Fira Barcelona but far away from city center, you have to take subway in that case. The hotel facilities are very good for a 4* hotel and the room is big and clean. The hotel staff is very professional and try to help you in all things that you demand.

Reviews.Title: “Good pre cruise stop off”
Reviews.Author: blueboy1952dave
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night, room spacious and comfortable. Reception staff very friendly and helpful, free Wi Fi available in foyer but it incurs a charge in your room. Breakfast continental with a few options, quite adequate. Only negative was our decision to have have a pre bed drink, 2 Jack Daniels and one coke 30 Euros !!!!!. Hotel overall very nice, just bring a nightcap with unless you belong to the jetset. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in a very expensive city”
Reviews.Author: buoybell
Reviews.Content: This hotel is at a very good location, right next to the main Sants train station and the metro. The green line metro stop is right outside the hotel, and runs to all the major sites. Rooms were inexpensive compared to most hotels in Barcelona. Staff were friendly and helpful. there is free one hour internet in the lobby, but otherwise you pay for it in your room. With regard to some of the other reviews, I agree with the funky smell. Our first room had the smell of smoke and mold, so we asked for another (which they quickly did). The second room did not have the smoke smell, but still was a funky smell from the AC. Speaking of which, if you open the window, the AC completly shuts down. To get it started again, you need to Slam the window shut! took us a couple of times to figure this out. I also agree with the comment in another review about the bakery across the street. A great place for breakfast and coffee in the afternoon. Staff there are very friendly. Otherwise, not much in the way of restruants in the area. Best to head to Gothic Quarter or Ramblus.

Reviews.Title: “A bit smelly, but OK”
Reviews.Author: omern
Reviews.Content: Good location just by a metro station and sants railway station, it offers quite big room, big shower and good service. There is a bit smell in the rooms and in the hotel (probably because its old) and the shower head was older then me, and dis functioning.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe the Best Deal in Town”
Reviews.Author: minkmeister
Reviews.Content: While the Abba Sants may not be mistaken for a 5 star resort considering it's location and uninspired exterior, it is, without a doubt one of the best deals in Barcelona. The rooms are spacious, well appointed, and clean! Really much as you would expect since this seems to be a business hotel geared toward the business traveller, but it is really great for the tourist as well. We have stayed here on several occasions and have always been pleased. The staff is exceedingly courteous and do their best to speak with the americans in english. Usually with great results! Breakfast was included, and was generous for a european hotel with plentiful coffee, and fresh OJ which we americans seem to have soundly renounced in our own country. It's a buffet, with good selection of breads, meats, eggs, etc. The bar is small, but well stocked and not outrageously priced as in most hotels. Don't go here for the atmosphere though, it's very pleasant and relaxing to lounge in, but definitely not the place of your looking for Saturday night excitement. While you may have to signal for the bartender during slow times, once they know you are there, service is always provided with a great smile and a generous pour. It should be noted that the bar does close at 12:30 (AM that is) so you'll have to find someplace else for latte night adult beverages. The location close to the train station is convenient for those using that mode of transport, but if you're looking for touristy things, be prepared to hoof it or use one of the adjacent metro stops. Also, be aware that you are in the city and near the train station so don't go leaving your bags to fend for themselves, they may just sprout legs and wander off. This place is a great deal for anyone wanting a solid hotel at a reasonable price. I know we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelingal8784
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff was very pleasant. Breakfast was amazing....very american (eggs, bacon, etc.) Hotel was clean, rooms were clean and had a lot of room. If I return to Barcelona I will stay in this hotel no matter what. Good location....right next to the metro stop but also not a big tourist area.

Reviews.Title: “excellent accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Anada-70
Reviews.Content: Great 4 stars S hotel, not expensive at all considered the service. We stayed one week two couples in two rooms, clean, comfortable and perfectly equipped. Big bathroom with complete courtesy kit. Very helpful, agreable Reception (thanks and greetengs to Ivan, in particular, nice and professional). The location is great thanks to the position of Sants Estaciò metro, just 50 mt far, a main line to go easily everywhere. Safe and calm surroundings perfect if you prefer to stay far from the noise of the city center but close enough to get it. I work as a touristic consultant and for my experience I would go back for sure. Antonella.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotal”
Reviews.Author: HannahSt
Reviews.Content: Nice modern hotel near center of Barcelona. Rooms are nicely decorated and comfortable. The best thing about hotel is its location. There is Sants tube station only a few meters from hotel and you can get anywhere in Barcelona within 10 minutes. I would stay here again definitely.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: INDEPENDANTTRAVELLER
Reviews.Content: we booked this as a stopover on our way to the coast, we were arriving a little late to continue our journey by train so we chose this due to the location for Sants station. we have previously stayed in the Barcelo Sants and we found that on this occasion, the Abba was about £20 cheaper and we also found it to be a bit better. It's easy to find from the station and check in was smooth and quick, we had booked through an online booking service so we had already paid before we arrived. We chose not to book breakfast as we're not big breakfast eaters and it was quite expensive, I find that with these hotels, this is often the case. the room was overlooking the main road but we did not hear any traffic, we had a great night's sleep! the bed was at least a king size and the room was quite spacious. In the bathroom there was the usual toiletries and more, shaving kit , toothpaste etc. the shower was lovely and powerful. we didn't use any of the facilities as we just stayed overnight and left the next morning. we sould definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Good, comfortable and convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: weeherdy
Reviews.Content: We booked this at very last minute on basis of reviews here and also its location. 25 mins or so from airport and parking nearby. Also very convenient for BCN's excellent (and largely wheelchair accessible) Metro, so only 10 mins or so from the centre. Staff were helpful and freindly and rooms were spacious and clean with lovely bathrooms with baths (as we have found in other Spanish hotels). We did not eat here as breakfast seemed pricey and it also appearred that yo had to book a breakfsat slot the night before 9which i did not read til the morning!) But no problem cos excellent little cafe almost directly across the road where 4 of us had breakfast for E11 ! The hotel will also store luggage during the day, which was great for us as we had quite a lot and our flight was not until 21.20. They do not even charge for this, which I find amazing. Only criticism really would be how noisy the street below is (we had 2 rooms on 3rd floor). I did not notice so much but my husband had a very disturbed night with cars, sirens etc. They do say the rooms are sound-proofed, which indeed they may be internally, but the double glazing seemed to let a lot of noise through.

Reviews.Title: “Great place...central to public transport, clean and comfy”
Reviews.Author: CMXNZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice on our European trip and it was great. Quite business focussed obviously but that didnt bother us. The staff were friendly, rooms clean, well priced and well serviced with public transport just outside the door. The hotel stored our luggage for us while we were away at no charge which was very helpful. We had a first floor room which was good as no lift waiting required. The only warning would be - there is no iron or ironing board - I had my dress ironed and it cost 14 Euro!! Mind you she made a super job of it! So if you are fussy about creases take a travel iron or you can pick one up at the shop around the corner for 10 Euro. Otherwise - great and recommend.

Reviews.Title: “An Unexpected Gem, definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: felix33442
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure if this was going to be a good move or a bad move on my part, booking a hotel that was not on the Ramblas. It turned out to be a great move! The hotel is literally just steps away from the metro station that goes to ALL of the main attractions in Barcelona, plus stops at 3 different places on the Ramblas. Buy a 10-trip metro ticket (good for more than one person), and save a huge amount over being right off the Ramblas! Hotel is immaculate. In fact, the hallways smelled a bit antiseptic, but hey, better clean than other smells! The rooms (we had a double) have windows that open to let in the breezes, great air conditioning, a full bathroom replete with every type of amenity, and a trouser press, which works as an iron for just about every article of clothing wrinkled in your suitcase. The beds are very firm. Pillows are basic hypoallergenic - no down available, but happy to give you as many as you want. The rooms were impeccably clean. Nicely laid out as well, with two single beds, a desk, place to put your luggage, an in-room safe (free), closet and nice size bathroom with shower and tub. The service was friendly, free wi-fi in the lobby (ask at the front desk), the front desk employees spoke decent English and were happy to help with everything requested. A buffet breakfast is available in the hotel. We opted to eat light and headed across the street to the local bakery, where the service sucked but the pastries were good. The hotel had better cappacino though. We ate one night in the restaurants near the hotel, but never actually ate at the hotel, so I can't comment on their food. The drinks were reasonably priced and the bar tenders happy to make a virgin pina colada for my son nightly. My son and I were very happy with this hotel, and since it took only 10 minutes by metro to get into the heart of the Ramblas, the price differental makes this hotel a true find. Plus, no noise to keep you awake at night. The metro was clean, and while everyone tells you to be careful, hold your purse in front of you (mailman style) etc., neither my teenage son nor I were bothered at any time. We found the metro to be clean, comfortable, fast and easy to figure out. The area around this hotel is filled with restaurants, a laundry service, 2 ATM's, and some stores. Nothing of major interest to "see" in the area, but safe enough to walk around. It's also only a few short blocks to the main train station should you want to visit Monsterrat or are heading say to Madrid. If you are going to the port, just ask the desk to call you a cab. Price from airport to this hotel ran around 25 Euro. I definitely recommend this hotel as a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Super Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Seavapor
Reviews.Content: This hotel was included as part of a tour. The room was good, with a nice view of a vacant lot - which is better than the street. The rooms had a pile of travel goodies in the bathroom, like combs, cologne, bath sponges, toothbrushes, etc. The breakfast was plentiful with many choices. Plus, when my father left his glasses on a tour bus, the best the tour company could do was to have a driver who was receiving passengers at the train station (very close by) bring the glasses. I was not completely sure of the spot for the pick up, so an employee offered to escort me to the pick-up. This was amazing! Plus, when I tried to offer her a tip she refused it! also, the location is just next to a metro stop and, as noted earlier, very close to the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Accessible Location”
Reviews.Author: ZAIDYY
Reviews.Content: I decided to book a room after reading about it in TA. The hotel is easy to reach from the airport ; 5-10 minutes walk from Barca train station. there is also a metro stop outside the hotel which makes it really easy to move around. Room is above average and clean, A/C works (important during this time of the year). we also liked the breakfast buffet. There are other hotels in the area in case location is what you want, they may even be cheaper or better. Having said that; I did like ABBA SANTS and would go back if ever in Barca again.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, not a "best value"”
Reviews.Author: ChipoChipolini
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and near a metro station. We think the hotel is overpriced because it didnt include breakfast, internet in the room or any other services.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel - perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: VK1984
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was near the barcelona sants station. We were very happy with our choice. this is truly a 4 star hotel. The rooms were excellent, the hotel staff very friendly and its right next to the station. You can get to the city centre in about 15 mins by metro. We had requested for an early check-in. Most of the hotels do not allow that. The staff in this hotel were friendly and allowed us to check in early. Excellent supplies provided in the toilet, which was very clean and big. Very happy with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent price/quality relationship”
Reviews.Author: Kolia
Reviews.Content: This 4* hotel is conveniently located very close to Plaza Sants (central Barcelona railway station), just 5 minutes walk. The access to the metro is nearly in front of the hotel. The taxi from the airport to the hotel cost me around 26 EUR. As I had no luggage, the taxi driver has offered me to leave me in front of the hotel and not at the door. I just had to cross the street. The reason is that many streets in Barcelona are one way, so if you have a lot of luggage the taxi would need to go around the neighbourhood for leaving you at the door. This will make your journey a bit longer and a bit more expensive. I have nothing special to say about the lobby of the hotel, the receptionists were friendly efficient and helpful. The room was nice but the bathroom had some bad smell that has gone after I have used the shower. I must say that I was surprised by the power of the water supply. I have never seen such a power in any hotel. It was like from a pipe filling in a swiming pool. But as the taps are good it was not difficult to adjust. So if you want a good shower, this hotel is definitely for you ;-) The mattress was comfortable, usual for Abba chain. Good quality bed linen, aslo usual for Abba. As I have stayed in this hotel only for one night and did not use any of the services, I can not say a lot more. I would say that this is a good option for those who need a reasonably priced hotel close to Plaza Sants. There are many hotels in the area, but on my opinion this one has one of the best one price/quality relationship. The only thing I missed was a free internet connection inside the room, but if you need to find something in the internet, the receptionists will assist you without any problem or will let you use the computer in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: saqrajan
Reviews.Content: We booked a triple room at this hotel and we were not disappointed! 3 full beds fantastic modern room and shower. Very clean and modern and it literally is 5 steps from the main Sants station which made travel super easy and quick. Great cafes and restaurants near by! Professional staff this is def one hotel to stay at if you wish to be away from all the action near eg La Rambla but close enough to get to all the major attractions! Would fef book this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel next to Barcelona Sants Trains station”
Reviews.Author: Farhi23
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel. Got there close to midnight, reception is fully active in these hours. Got a room with a very nice porch. There are bath accessories that are very handly for business travel. The breakfast buffet was very nice with self service coffee machine.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay at Abba Sants Hotel May 2004”
Reviews.Author: CherrytreesGlasgow
Reviews.Content: Sorry this is a duplicate review, I've re joined Trip Advisor and wanted to add this hotel to my profile. 8 lovely ladies from Glasgow, flying over to the wonderful city of Barcelona for my hen weekend in May 2004. Our ages ranged from 24 to 58, so finding the right hotel that would suit everyone's tastes and expectations was going to be a challenge. The Abba Sants Hotel proved to be the perfect choice. The hotel was stunning. It was immaculately clean, the bedrooms were freshly decorated and the staff were so helpful and polite, even when it was quite obvious that we had had one to many champagne cocktails!! I would highly recommend this hotel, and would seriously consider booking again either for a romantic weekend away or for another girls weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for EIBTM”
Reviews.Author: lebowski481
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice and it is great place to stay when you visit EIBTM. The room is nice and clean. I do not try any catering but there is great bageteria infront of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: dodoman
Reviews.Content: I stay 4 nights during fair EIBTM. Very good location for Gran Viaja fair area, airport and city centre. Room was clean, more than usual cosmetic set in bathroom, very good bed and bed facilities. Friendly and helpful staff. Can recommend :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Carlos
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfectly situated near the main train station, which is linked nicely to the airport. Like with a lot of European hotels the room wasn’t particularly huge however you don’t come all the way to Barcelona to sit in a hotel room. The reception was very nice and always busy which told me this was a popular hotel. The hotel is about a 40min walk from the main tourist area of Las Rambles but the good thing is that there is a metro right outside the hotel which is very easy to use and will take no more than 10mins to get too. Overall I couldn’t fault this hotel for connivance and price.

Reviews.Title: “very good value”
Reviews.Author: maryb12345
Reviews.Content: A modern hotel with clean, spacious rooms and bathrooms. Good quality beds. Metro (subway) is fifty feet from front and main train terminal (use from airport) is about three blocks away. Places to eat all around. We want a clean place with nearby transport for a low price. This fit the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for Train Travel and Metro”
Reviews.Author: NewZealandTippler
Reviews.Content: Selected this hotel for its proximity to Rail Station. Staff very helpful and friendly, good breakfast, and also handy for the 'hop off/on' bus tour of the city. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “perfection”
Reviews.Author: remedios17
Reviews.Content: I completely adore this hotel. It's located 5 metres away from the Sants Estació metro station, which makes everything so much easier! Also, it's very close to Sants Estació itself. The rooms are beautiful, the bathroom is clean, lots of tv channels, even German and British ones, internet access (although not for free). The staff is not the nicest, but they do everything they can. We had some minor problems with the air conditioning, and they immediately offered new rooms. The rooms are very quiet, you can't hear your neighbors at all, and the elevator is not noisy (our room was next to it). Overall, it's the perfect four-star hotel, HIGHLY recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “The staff wasn't very friendly, but the room was great”
Reviews.Author: svartman
Reviews.Content: When we arrived from Morocco, after many hours of buses, taxis, planes and trains, we were tired (and look tired, with our backpacks on our shoulders), and in desperate need of a shower and a bed. But all we got was contempt from the manager, that didn't even look us in the eye and said several times out loud, to his assistant: "don't forget to charge them in advance". Nobody showed up to take our bags to the room. Having said that, the room is spacious and clean, the bathtub works perfectly fine and there is a subway station right on the hotel's door.

Reviews.Title: “Very accessible for public transport.”
Reviews.Author: groovygranLondon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated close to Sants station,the train from the airport is only 70 cents if you buy a "10 ticket" There is a Metro station right outside the door and lots of local buses. Rooms are comfortable with very comfortable beds and good reading lights. The good sized bathroom has a fast shower .Staff were helpful and friendly. At the time we were there some work was going on at the rear of the hotel. As we were out all day it did not affect us although it could be noisy if you wanted to sleep late.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is well located.”
Reviews.Author: fongcm89
Reviews.Content: We are very happy with the location of the hotel as it is very close to the train station. The hotel staff are very helpful especially Sergi at the reception counter. Breakfast is very good. However, the room service can be further improved. Would surely recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room”
Reviews.Author: sakejima
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is very good, very near to the Barcelona train station. The room is convenient and the service is good.

Reviews.Title: “peaceful location and convenient to the metro station”
Reviews.Author: pparisienne
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is not walking distance to where the actions are, we didn't mind as the SANTS metro station (which stops to just about all the major sights) is just right outside of the hotel. We appreciate the location as the neighborhood is relatively safe and quiet. We were also quite happy with the room as it was clean,comfortable, with a nice, big bathroom!

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel with excellent staff.”
Reviews.Author: lhirst
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as part of a Brittany Ferries tourng holiday and don't have a lot to add to previous reviews.It's modern,spotlessly clean bedrooms are fine for a few days.It's close to a metro station with a direct line to the Ramblas area.It's also close to Sants station where you can pick up the Tourist Bus which is one of the best ways to get around the city as you can interchange with three routes and hop on and off as often as you like.Although we didn't dine in the restaurant in the evening,breakfast is fine although very busy. What sets the Abba Sants apart from many other city centre hotels is it's front of house staff.Nothing is too much trouble and they will do everything to help guests.I would recommend this place for it's staff alone.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice of hotel......”
Reviews.Author: Linz3003
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Abba Sants back in Feb/Mar'08. Lovely hotel seemingly located in a business district. There is a train station just past the hotel, but personally prefer travelling by taxi when abroad. It's also not too far from the camp nou which we visited three times while in Barca on a 5 day break! There was only one restaurant within the hotel - a bit on the small side and menu options were limited. But as we soon discovered while exploring the sourding area there are plenty of restaurant to choice from. Would happy return to this hotel on my next visit!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Jujuki
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 1 night during a business trip in Spain. It is located just opposite the train station Sants, so it is ideal for people travelling by train. Even if it is not right in the city centre, there is a metro station right outside the hotel, allowing you to be in Las Ramblas in few minutes. The room was nice and comfortable. The front desk staff as well as the room service staff was helpful and polite. It was not expensive for a 4* hotel and definitely worth the money. I would go to this hotel again and would recommend it to business travellers as well as tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shopaholic18
Reviews.Content: Could not fault the Abba Sants Hotel! The beds are big and comfy, the rooms are spacious! Staff are polite and helpful, the hotel was sleek and modern and it was located right beside an underground metro station! Had a great stay here and would definitely return again!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: johher66
Reviews.Content: Business trip i Barcelona. Stayed at this hotel i Barcelona during feb 2008. Had a room in 7th floor, who is the executive floor. Nothing special with that. Very clean, but hot. The air condition was not working. Maybe because it is out of season for that. So the room was very warm, and I had to have the window open during the night. The hotel restaurant is expensive related to the othe restaurants nearby. Very good food in this hotel restaurant. The hotel is not in the tourist part of Barcelona, and you need to take a taxi to get to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Geatv value”
Reviews.Author: HolidaysCanada
Reviews.Content: Nice spot, handy location, opposite tube/metro/subway. Great room, excellent buffet breakfast. Not many food/bars close by. Would defintely stay there again. 100 euros a night less than anything comparable near the Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Very good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: tiralb
Reviews.Content: The Abba Sants hotel in Barcelona is in a good, but not spectacular, location near the Sants Railroad Station in Barcelona. It has excellent access to the Metro (only a few meters from the hotel entrance). The hotel itself is very clean. The rooms are comfortable, though the lower floors can have depressingly dark rooms. It is very nice that most of the rooms in the hotel are non-smoking (though this may be a problem for some smokers - so be aware of this). The bathrooms have fixtures that function very well. Beds are comfortable - though I did have one problem with a broken bed. This problem was resolved by accommodating me in an executive room! The reception staff was particularly impressive. They worked very efficiently, were very friendly and went out of their way to make my stay very pleasant. Indeed, I have not been in any hotel with more accommodating staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: kalypratt
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Abba Sants hotel. It is very comfortable, modern hotel. It's location, a few minutes walk from the Sants train station, is very convenient for travelers who are visiting the city. The hotel staff was great about giving restaurant recommendations that locals actually go to. The only downside was that the rooms were uncomfortably warm and the only way to cool down was to open the window which unfortunately let in the noise from a very busy street.

Reviews.Title: “a good deal”
Reviews.Author: 1234ME
Reviews.Content: Out of the limited choices offered by the travel agent (there was a kind of convention or something that occupied a lot of places), we selected this one for a week-end stay in Barcelona (before heading for Sitges). The hotel room was nice, large and clean and without noise although it faced the street. If you forgot your toothbrush or toothpaste, or even your hairbrush - no problem, you will find some in the bathroom. It has a nice location, not in the "old town" but close enough to make the metro trip a short one. The metro in Barcelona can be ok if you do not take it at a rush hour, and it offers you a good alternative for the car (I could not see nice parking spaces in the old part of the city). Of course, there is the tourist bus, but to get it you need to get to the centre. We had dinner once in the restaurant of the hotel. The choice was quite limited and the prices were not on the low side (but in Barcelona prices are not low in good restaurants - or we could not find them in the limited time available to us). The breakfast was nice though, with a lot of good things from which even a vegan could make a selection.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ceadmile
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as we extended our weekend in Barcelona (stayed previous 2 nights at Gran Torre). Just up the street from the Gran Torre(see review) and although we had been spoiled by the previous hotels views we found the Abba Sants excellent. The staff were very friendly and helpful. As we were transferring early on a Saturday morning we were hoping to just be able to store our bags but our room was ready and waiting for us. Although we had a room facing the street there was no noise. After a day sightseeing I don't think anything would have woken me. The breakfast the next morning was full of choice..the fresh pastries were excellent!! Would recommend this hotel wholeheartedly as it is excellent value for money and within minutes walking distance from Sants Estacio with a metro station just outside the door!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel good area”
Reviews.Author: Andylane
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with five mates from the ages of 21 to 78. Very good stay. Close to Metro - buy a T-10 ticket AND buy it at the airport railway station - it can be used on the train to the city saving a couple of Euros. Hotel spacious well run with nice rooms and very good buffet breakfast. If you want a few good basic bars get the Metro out to Can Vidalet and Via Julia, plenty of local culture. We've booked to go back in March 2007.

Reviews.Title: “Could not fault the Abba Sants”
Reviews.Author: Steve12
Reviews.Content: Obviously a hotel catering for the business traveller in a business area of Barcelona. That said with a Barcelona Travel Pass and the Bus stop, Underground yards away, and the Railway station 200 yards away - everything in Barcelona is within easy reach. Never used a taxi yet. Good cafes across the road but good quality meals are cheap in Barcelona typically 3 courses with wine 12 euros. Even late at night the area appeared safe - we never were aware of any hassles. The Hotel staff are friendly, polite and very helpful and the modern marble decor thoughout was spotlessly clean. Our standard double room was a king size bed with loads of space and a well appointed bathroom. Breakfast was magnificent with a buffet for as much as you wanted. We were from Scotland on a FlyGlobespan deal and could not rate the whole package any higher. If we ever go to Barcelona again it will be back to the Abba Sants.

Reviews.Title: “Try the Irish Coffee!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Abba Sants is not in the most obvious location in Barcelona - you're not especially close to the Ramblas or any of the other main attractions. However, it's right beside the underground and the main train line so it's incredibly easy to get around. In essence, it's a business hotel and we didn't see a great number of tourists there. The rooms have that 'business traveller' feel: they're well appointed, and definitely classier than a travelodge, but there's nothing extraordinary or special. The service was exceptional. The staff were efficient and friendly, despite our broken Spanish. At times, we felt the business clients got preferential treatment in the bar, etc, but it was hardly a problem. Particularly when they served such spectacular Irish Coffee!!! A great hotel for those visiting Barcelona on a budget. We'd certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: ehm612
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May last year and it exceeded all expectations, very clean, well presented rooms, friendly staff and conveniently located next to the Metro. I can without a doubt say that I will definately be coming back here very soon. I cant comment on the breakfast as I was on a room only basis but the cafe across the road was beautiful. Your only a Metro ride away from the "Las Ramblas" so nights out are easy and just catch a taxi back. I would recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: LAZER73
Reviews.Content: I recommend this hotel. Great for those who want to take the train in from the airport. You can wheel your bags two blocks to the hotel and avoid the taxi fare. A small bakery across the street is great for breakfast. There is an internet shop one block away. I paid 40 cents for fifteen minutes to check my emails. The subway stop stairs are right out the door of the hotel. We stayed on the 7th floor and the room was fine and quiet. The bus touristic which I dont recommend stops at the train station by the way.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: tylerd
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the Bank Holiday Weekend. Its a great hotel with everything you would want. The rooms were really nice, really comfortable king size bed, great bathrooms, breakfast is superb. The location is great because its right outside the metro station and you can go everywhere from there. Also, if your looking to travel to other areas within Spain theres also a railway station close by. Service was good too. Its not walking distance to the Ramblas and Beachside (although thats certainly possible if your in the mood for a long stroll) but otherwise its great! Its closer to Lilla and the shops around there.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay @ Abba Sants Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 8 lovely ladies from Glasgow, flying over to the wonderful city of Barcelona for my hen weekend. Our ages ranged from 24 to 58, so finding the right hotel that would suit everyone's tastes and expectations was going to be a challenge. The Abba Sants Hotel proved to be the perfect choice. The hotel was stunning. It was immaculately clean, the bedrooms were freshly decorated and the staff were so helpful and polite, even when it was quite obvious that we had had one to many champagne cocktails!! I would highly recommend this hotel, and would seriously consider booking again either for a romantic weekend away or for another girls weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: RutlandKatie
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a 2 night stay at the Abba Sants. Hotel in a good location for travelling from the airport and for getting around the city - the main train station (20 mins direct train link to the airport) and metro are virtually on your doorstep. Rooms are clean and functional - not what I would call 4 star, although the bathrooms are nice. We didn't find the beds that comfortable. Felt the hotel was lacking in atmosphere - had quite a 'corporate' feel and we didn't find the staff particularly friendly or helpful. The breakfasts are excellent with plenty of choice. This is an ideal hotel to use as a base for exploring Barcelona and would recommend it for a weekend stay. However, if you are staying any longer or if you want to get the real Barcelona atmosphere then this hotel is not for you.

HotelInfo.Name: Abba Sants Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: C/ Numancia 32, 08029 Barcelona, Spain
